title: Prisoners use dating apps for illegal liaisons as Ministers launch new unit to target surge in smart phones in jails
text:
Prisoners are using dating apps to arrange illegal liaisons with women, it has emerged, as ministers announced a new digital forensics unit to probe offenders using phones to run their criminal empires from jail.

The Ministry of Justice (MoJ) revealed digital investigators identified a criminal judged a risk to women from an anonymous account he had used to fix up a date on his release from open prison.

Investigators only had his profile “david8811” and a false claim that he was in custody in a Welsh jail to go on but managed to track him down to an open prison in the Midlands where he was arrested for possession of a smartphone, illegal communications and possession of drugs.
